questions.question: Your company launches an 'AI Champions' program. You:

answers.B: Ask how 'champion' success will be measured.
answers.C: Feel anxious—does this mean my job is at risk?
answers.D: Worry about the ethics of moving too fast.
answers.F: See a chance to make a name for yourself.
answers.G: Ask how it will affect support staff and junior employees.

questions.question: A colleague uses AI to finish a project in half the time. Your reaction?

answers.A: Ask them to show you how!
answers.B: Wonder if the output quality was measured.
answers.C: Secretly worry you can't keep up.
answers.E: Feel skeptical about relying on a tool.
answers.F: Brainstorm how to automate even more.
answers.G: Check if anyone was left out or missed a chance to learn.

questions.question: How do you keep up with AI trends?

answers.B: Wait for official company updates or reports.
answers.D: Follow AI ethics forums or regulatory news.
answers.F: Attend 'future of work' events and hackathons.
answers.G: Watch for stories on AI's social impact.

questions.question: Your leadership says AI will require 'reskilling.' You:

answers.A: Look up training courses right away.
answers.B: Want a timeline, metrics, and job guarantees.
answers.D: Want to ensure training is voluntary and fair.
answers.F: Suggest creating new roles for AI strategists.
answers.G: Volunteer to mentor those most at risk.

questions.question: What's your biggest question about AI?

answers.A: 'How can I use it to work smarter?'
answers.F: 'How can it help us beat competitors?'

questions.question: You're assigned to an AI implementation team. What's your role?

answers.C: Quiet observer, taking it all in.
answers.F: Idea generator, pushing for more change.

questions.question: How do you feel about 'AI replacing jobs?'

answers.A: It's a chance to move up or into new areas.
answers.B: Only acceptable if it clearly benefits the business.
answers.D: It should be tightly controlled and monitored.

questions.question: When a new AI policy is announced, you:

answers.A: Read it and look for ways to leverage it.
answers.B: Study the details and ask for clarification.
answers.C: Wait to see how it impacts you.
answers.D: Check for privacy or bias safeguards.
answers.E: Hope it doesn't change daily routines.
answers.G: Survey coworkers about their comfort level.

questions.question: Your team faces a tight deadline. What's your approach?

answers.A: Use every tool, including AI, to get results.
answers.B: Weigh risks vs. benefits before changing workflow.
answers.C: Prefer to stick with what you know works.
answers.D: Only use tools that have been vetted for fairness/ethics.
answers.F: Suggest splitting the work—humans + AI for speed.
answers.G: Make sure no one gets left out under stress.

questions.question: What's your ideal relationship with AI at work?

answers.A: Collaborator—side by side, learning and growing.
answers.B: Consultant—advice only, with final say by people.
answers.C: Support—only as needed, never front and center.
answers.D: Watchdog—monitor, question, and keep it in check.
answers.E: Minimal—keep AI out of the core.
answers.F: Accelerator—push the boundaries and redefine work.
answers.G: Equalizer—help level the playing field for all.
